column1: Instructions were kinda wrinkled. Only bad part about the bags is that things can get wrinkled. In the back of the instructions there's a picture of the combiner model which actually looks pretty good.

In terms of new parts, Core Hunter is lacking. The only exclusive part to this set is the helmet. It's a lovely design with the six eyes and vent-like mouth. The other new piece is the ankle guard (first seen in Ultrabuild Captain America). While not entirely new, it is new in color, that being black, and in the Breakout wave 2 line-up.

He does come with some recolors, though. Black Savage Planet ""paws"", a black Multi Tool Ice Shield, and the new torso piece in black. I'm not sure if they've been in this color before, but there are curved red claws that can also be mentioned. Interesting parts include the bandolier,
column3: chest piece, and the shortest bone pieces.&nbsp
column4: All these pieces I'm sure will be useful to MoCists.

column1: Unfortunately, Core Hunter has a pretty generic build. It's really no different compared to your average Hero. The only thing that may make it interesting is the construction of the back armor and the claw, but
column3: they shouldn't even be included. Other&nbsp
column4: sets had something that made the build somewhat unique. Voltix had the ""on/off switch"" on his back, Furno has the jetpack, etc. But I guess there's really nothing they could have done to Core Hunter to make him more interesting of a build.

column1: Despite the not-so thrilling build, Core Hunter is a fantastic looking set. The black and red coloring is superb and makes him look evil. I mean, really. He's like exclusively black and red aside from the weapons which are gunmetal. Speaking of which, they aren't too interesting, but they get the job done.
